qna_data.subject: ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt
qna_data.question: What does the ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt extension do?
qna_data.answer: The ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt extension allows the user to save a PNG or JPEG of each image within Comfy and offers an option to save the prompt/workflow in a text or JSON file for each image, along with the capability to disable saving the prompt or previews, and choose a specific folder to save them to.

qna_data.subject: ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt
qna_data.question: Can text tokens be used with ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt?
qna_data.answer: Yes, text tokens can be used with ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt. It includes built-in tokens like [time], [time(format_code)], [hostname], and [user] to format the output file names.

qna_data.subject: ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt
qna_data.question: How can I install the ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt extension?
qna_data.answer: To install the ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt extension, use the command 'git clone https://github.com/mpiquero7164/ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt.git' in your ComfyUI custom nodes directory. After cloning, restart ComfyUI, and the extension will be ready to use.

qna_data.subject: ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt
qna_data.question: Which category can I find the ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt node in?
qna_data.answer: The ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt node can be found in the IO category within ComfyUI.

qna_data.subject: ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt
qna_data.question: What is the format of the text tokens for date and time?
qna_data.answer: The format of the text tokens for date and time is based on Python's strftime directives, where you can specify directives like %a for the day of the week, %d for the day of the month, %m for the month as a zero-padded decimal number, and %Y for the year with century as a decimal number, among others.

qna_data.subject: ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt
qna_data.question: Where can I report issues or suggestions regarding the ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt extension?
qna_data.answer: Issues or suggestions regarding the ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt extension can be reported on the GitHub repository at https://github.com/mpiquero7164/ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt.
